Item.Name: EDDIE MURPHY 8 x 10 AUTOGRAPHED PHOTO
Item.Description: EDDIE MURPHY 8 x 10 AUTOGRAPHED PHOTO Model Color 139EDDIEMUR AS SHOWN Description AUTOGRAPHED PHOTO OF EDDIE MURPHY. During his career, Eddie Murphy has seen both great heights and remarkable lows. He is a true Hollywood celebrity who offers both great performances and laughably bad ones with a healthy dose of scandal thrown into the mix. Eddie was always too smart and too vocal for his own good. Growing up in the Bushwick projects in Brooklyn, New York, he used to stage big contests with his friends in which they would try and outdo each other with elaborate insults. He developed a knack for doing different voices from television at an early age and was the family entertainer. Being such a prominent celebrity took its toll- not only was his fast lane life scrutinized in the press, but many prominent black leaders also criticized him for doing little to help blacks break into Hollywood. He attempted to make up for things with 1991`s Harlem Nights, which boasted a large ensemble of black talent, but the film was a dud and audiences stayed away. Eddie has returned to box office success in more recent years with hits like Dr. Doolittle and The Nutty Professor. Item.Name: Jamie Lee Curtis - HALLOWEEN II [New DVD]
Item.Description: Jamie Lee Curtis _ Donald Pleasance HALLOWEEN II DVD (5") _ Goodtimes / Universal (05-81022) _ Widescreen English surround _ French / Spanish subtitles Color _ 93 minutes _ Region 1 The nightmare isn't over _ Presented in widescreen, the sequel to _Halloween_ picks up right where the original left off, reuniting Jamie Lee Curtis, Donald Pleasance, and writer-producer John Carpenter _ Find out what happened next _the night he came home_, as Michael pursues Laurie into a new bloodbath at the hospital, while Dr. Loomis frantically tries to understand _ and destroy _ him _ Goodtimes' release of John Carpenter's chilling horror film contains an interesting hidden feature that can easily escape viewers of the disc _ When you access the disc's _Scene Selection_ from the Main Menu, you will hear a segment of the movie's score playing while you work your way around the menu _ When it is finished, go to the next page of the menu, and you will hear another segment of the score playing _ If you then go to the next menu page, yet another segment of the score will play, and if you then go to the final screen of the scene selections, another piece of the film's haunting score will play for you _ Altogether, these separate pieces of music you can hear over the scene selections add up to build the entire music score of the movie _ Disc is brand new and factory sealed _ Buyer to pay $4.65 for USPS Priority shipping or $2.55 for USPS Media shipping within the U.S. _ International buyers _ please send address for quote _ Payment to be made within 14 days after end of auction _ Checks, accepted only from buyers with U.S. banks, held 10 business days for clearance Check my other auctions to save on combined shipping Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Item.Name: Souvenir Program Chicago Opera Bluebeard 1889
Item.Description: This souvenir program is printed on the front: CHICAGO OPERA HOUSE 100TH PERFORMANCE BLUEBEARD JR. OR FATIMA AND THE FAIRY, DAVID HENDERSON, MANAGER, TUESDAY, AUGUST 27, 1889." This program has eight pages inside the cover.There are two pages listing the cast and the parts they played, the synopsis of Scenery and Incidents for the four Acts and the prologue, pages with individual pictures of the actors and actresses in their costumes, two pages of pictures of the cast on state. One is Bluebeard's Arrival --The Banks of the Phosphorus and the other is The Grand Battle Tableau - The Death of Bluebeard. This program has a crease and a small tear on the bottom edge of the cover beneath the second A in the word manager. The right corners at the top and bottom of the cover are creased or broken off. There is some brown staining near the E and A on BLUEBEARD and there is a brown stain on the back cover near the middle of the right side. The inside is in very good condition. I have listed a number of Cabinet Photos of the actors and actresses that are pictured in this program and a number of stage pictures of the cast during the perfromance from this production. This is a very comprehensive piece of theater history for 1889. PAYMENT: California residents are required by law to pay 7.00% for the California Sales Tax. I accept only money order, cashiers check, personal check, or BidPay. I am sorry but I DO NOT ACCEPT PayPal or BillPoint or credit cards. SHIPPING: Buyer will pay shipping, handling, and insurance. BUYERS OUTSIDE THE USA: The cost of the shipping and handling would be figured after the bidding so I can get the cost of mailing to another country. Please understand that without insurance, I do not refund money for an item that is lost or damaged in the mail. I do pack items very carefully. BUYERS OUTSIDE THE USA are expected to pay in US Dollars. I work hard to photograph and describe each item. Please ask questions before the end of the auction by e-mail if there is something that concerns you. I try to give this information in the description if there is a variation, defect, or questionable area. Refunds are only granted if the item is not as described or pictured and if it is returned within 5 days of receiving and in the same condition as it was sent. Please be sure you want the item before you bid. I reserve the right to relist an item 10 days after the close of the auction if I have not received payment or worked out a delay with the bidder by e-mail. I want each bidder to be happy with my service, and I will try very hard to work with you in case there is any problem. Thank you for bidding on my items.

Item.Name: BULLWINKLE SHOW MATTED COLOR PHOTO 16X20
Item.Description: BULLWINKLE SHOW MATTED COLOR PHOTO 16X20 Model Color 19406 AS SHOWN Description BRAND NEW `THE BULLWINKLE SHOW` MATTED PHOTO, 16 x 20. The Bullwinkle Show had its premiere telecast on September 24, 1961. The characters and voice artists were Bullwinkle J. Moose - Bill Scott; Rocket J.(Rocky) Squirrel - June Foray; Boris Badenov - Paul Frees; Natasha Fatale - June Foray; Dudley Doright - Bill Scott; Snidley Whiplash - Hans Conried; Mr. Peabody - Bill Scott; Sherman - Walter Tetley; Aesop - Charles Ruggles; and William Conrad as the narrator. The Bullwinkle Show was a primetime show until September of 1962. It then continued running on Saturday mornings through 1964 and finally went to Sunday mornings where it remained until September of 1973. The show was then reintroduced Saturday mornings for the 1981-82 season. Other featured segments included `Fractured Fairy Tales`, `Peabody`s Improbable History` featuring Mr. Peabody and Sherman`s time travels, `Adventures of Dudley Doright` featuring a noble mountie confronted with the evil Snidley Whiplash and `Aesop and his Son` in which fables were recounted in unusual ways. Specs _ 16 x 20 _ Matted Color Photos Shipping We Ship INSIDE THE CONTINENTAL USA ONLY . (We do not ship to Hawaii or Alaska). Physical addresses ONLY ( NO P.O. boxes, military bases, etc .) Item.Name: Bait Jamie Foxx
Item.Description: Bait Jamie Foxx Bait * DVD * Jamie Foxx Alvin Sanders, a fast-talking street punk, is on his way to prison when he's stuck in a holding cell with a dying guy who has a $43 million secret: where stolen gold is hidden. With his last breath, the guy tells Alvin something that makes no sense to the US Treasury agent, Clenteen, who soon interrogates Alvin. Eighteen months later, Clenteen wants to find the robbery's mastermind, an elusive computer genius named Bristol, so he lets Alvin loose, as bait. As Alvin tries to find a job, make peace with his girlfriend, and take on fatherhood to a baby born while he was in jail, he's an unwitting pawn caught between the murderous Bristol and the uptight, hard-nosed Clenteen. Item.Name: MINT 1988 Betty Buckley CARRIE Souvenir Pgm
Item.Description: What an incredible find!!! This is a MINT Souvenir Programme from Broadway's Virginia Theatre's 1988 Friedrich Kurtz/Royal Shakespeare Company's musical production of CARRIE, based on the novel by Stephen King. The musical, which became one of the all-time flops of the century, starred Betty Buckley, Linzi Hatel, Darene Love, Gene Anthony Ray, Charlotte d'Amboise, Paul Gyngell and Sally Ann Triplett. This awesome oversized programme consists on 18 pages, is crammed from cover to cover with colour photographs from the production, and is in absolutely MINT condition. Besides the photos, there are numerous write-ups on the cast, crew and "creative team" behind this doomed musical. If you are a Betty Buckley fan, or after a piece of musical history, then this Souvenir Programme is a MUST for your collection!! Buyer agrees to pay an additional $3.95 for shipping. Item.Name: DVD - Power of One - Morgan Freeman
Item.Description: DVD - Power of One - Morgan Freeman Govatos' Just In Time For Christmas Mega DVD Sale! I have 73 DVD's up for sale RIGHT NOW! Shipping is $4.00, whether you win 1 or 73 auctions! All my DVDs have been well taken care of. I am good to my stuff, and my stuff will be good to you! The Power of One is an intriguing story of a young English boy named P.K. and his passion for changing the world. Growing up he suffered as the only English boy in an Afrikaans school. Soon orphaned, he was placed in the care of a German national named Professor von Vollensteen (a.k.a. "Doc"), a friend of his grandfather. Doc develops P.K.'s piano talent and P.K. becomes "assistant gardener" in Doc's cactus garden. It is not long after WWII begins that Doc is placed in prison for failure to register with the English government as a foreigner. P.K. makes frequent visits and meets Geel Piet, an inmate, who teaches him to box. Geel Piet spreads the myth of the Rainmaker, the one who brings peace to all of the tribes. P.K. is cast in the light of this myth. After the war P.K. attends an English private school where he continues to box. He meets a young girl, Maria, with whom he falls in love. Her father, Professor Daniel Marais, is a leader of the Nationalist Party of South Africa. The two fight to teach the natives English as P.K.'s popularity grows via the myth. Maria is killed. P.K. looses focus until he sees the success of his language school among the tribes. He and Guideon Duma continue the work in hopes of building a better future for Africa. Item.Name: DVD - Stepford Wives - Ira Levin
Item.Description: DVD - Stepford Wives - Ira Levin Govatos' Just In Time For Christmas Mega DVD Sale! I have 73 DVD's up for sale RIGHT NOW! Shipping is $4.00, whether you win 1 or 73 auctions! All my DVDs have been well taken care of. I am good to my stuff, and my stuff will be good to you! Joanna and Walter are the two newest residents in Stepford. Joanna, although a "housewife" is intelligent and creative - taking an interest in photography: she wants to be "remembered". Like many of the men in Stepford, Walter is an obviously inadequate husband. Conflict occurs when Joanna complains that Walter is making all of the decisions for them. Walter joins the mysterious Stepford "Men's Club", which takes place in an old manor house, which is heavily guarded. Joanna is disturbed that many of the Stepford wives spend their lives in domestic servitude, are unintelligent and wear flowery print dresses. Her friend Bobbie thinks that it might be due to something in the water. At a consciousness-raising group that Joanna starts, the wives begin discussing spray starch and cleaning products. The awful truth is that the men of Stepford are replacing their wives with compliant domestic sex robots. Gradually, Joanna begins to realise that all of her friends have been replaced, and that she is in great danger. Her psychiatrist advices that she takes the kids and gets "the hell out of Stepford", but the men are hiding Joanna's children. Can she find them, or will she be murdered and replaced by RoboJoanna? Item.Name: I, Claudius Episodes 7-9!
Item.Description: I, Claudius Episodes 7-9! Staring Derek Jacobi You will love this DVD!!. Episode Seven: QUEEN OF HEAVEN Tiberius revels in a life of erotic hedonism, living only for perverted pleasures, egged on by Agrippina_s cunning son, Caligula. His former allies see his end ahead and build ties to Claudius, next in line for the throne. Livia, a mere shell of her former self, now regrets her son_s savage reign. On her deathbed, she reveals the full scope of the family_s crimes to Claudius- and makes him promise that she will be revered as a goddess for generations to come Episode Eight: REIGN OF TERROR Tiberius, old and frail, slowly begins killing off all who could succeed him. Fearing assassination, he orders a purge, leaving the Senate piled high with the bodies of his enemies. Claudius survives only through cleverness. Finally, Tiberius banishes his long hated rival Agrippina along with her son, Nero. Caligula is now in position to capture the throne. Episode Nine: ZEUS, BY JOVE! On the brink of death, Tiberius name Caligula heir to the Roman throne. To win favor with the masses, Caligula spreads money left by Tiberius among the Roman people and pledges to pay off Livia_s debts. A new age of prosperity seems to be beginning. But Caligula soon descends i8nto madness. He declares himself a god and embarks on an orgy of bloodletting, murdering all who might challenge his heavenly rule- even his own sister. Item.Name: Animorphs: The Invasion Series ~ Promo Photo
Item.Description: Item Original 8x10 Glossy Movie Studio Limited Edition Media Promotional Photo Title Animorphs: The Invasion Series Featured in Photo ~ Year Photo Issued 1998 Please Note This is a rare, original , glossy movie promotional still. Original promo stills are like limited edition prints in that only a small number are issued to the media by a film studio publicity department for newspaper, magazine and television promotion. It is not a reprint or computer printed photo. Serious collectors know that original movie stills have the greatest collectible value.The quality of an original promotional still is outstanding--even the fine print is crystal clear. Get the real thing --not a reprint. You can own a piece of film history featuring one of your favorite films or film artists by adding an original still to your collection. Please see our other original movie and music promo photos in our other eBay auctions. Biolinks For detailed info on any film or film artist featured in our auctions we recommend the following sites: Film: The AMG Movie Guide Television and Film: The Internet Movie Database Guarantee Starlight Collectibles has been in business on eBay for over three years. We have nearly 2,000 successful transactions and satisfied customers. As a collector for over 30 years myself I understand how important it is to receive an item promptly, in the condition stated and securely packaged. We stand behind our products and service 100%, and we have a 14-day money-back return policy on all items. If you have any problems or questions before or after the sale please e-mail me directly. You can bid with confidence when you bid on a Starlight item. Condition MINT Photo Scans rarely do photos justice. The scan is at a much lower resolution than the actual photo, which is crisp and clear. If the photo appears to have any flaws, such as blurring, discoloring or uneven borders--and they are not noted in the "Condition" box above--they are merely scanner distortions. Servers will often make photos appear lighter or darker--all of our original promo photos are perfectly exposed. The item may be set against a black background to improve the quality of the scan, but the item is in no way attached to the background.. Item.Name: Benicio Del Toro, OOP 1996 Promo Photo
Item.Description: Item Original 8x10 Glossy Movie Studio Limited Edition Media Promotional Photo Title Basquiat Featured in Photo Benicio Del Toro, Claire Forlani Year Photo Issued 1996 Please Note This is a rare, original , glossy movie promotional still. Original promo stills are like limited edition prints in that only a small number are issued to the media by a film studio publicity department for newspaper, magazine and television promotion and go out of print soon thereafter. It is not a reprint or computer printed photo. Serious collectors know that original movie stills have the greatest collectible value.The quality of an original promotional still is outstanding--even the fine print is crystal clear. Get the real thing --not a reprint. You can own a piece of film history featuring one of your favorite films or film artists by adding an original still to your collection. As with many collectibles, you may find that you can have the pleasure of owning the photo and find that it will go up in value in time. Please see our other original movie and music promo photos in our other eBay auctions. Biolinks For detailed info on any film or film artist featured in our auctions we recommend the following sites: Film: The AMG Movie Guide Television and Film: The Internet Movie Database Guarantee Starlight Collectibles has been in business on eBay for over three years. We have nearly 2,000 successful transactions and satisfied customers. As a collector for over 30 years myself I understand how important it is to receive an item promptly, in the condition stated and securely packaged. We stand behind our products and service 100%, and we have a 14-day money-back return policy on all items. If you have any problems or questions before or after the sale please e-mail me directly. You can bid with confidence when you bid on a Starlight item. Condition MINT Photo Scans rarely do photos justice. The scan is at a much lower resolution than the actual photo, which is crisp and clear. If the photo appears to have any flaws, such as blurring, discoloring or uneven borders--and they are not noted in the "Condition" box above--they are merely scanner distortions. Servers will often make photos appear lighter or darker--all of our original promo photos are perfectly exposed. The item may be set against a black background to improve the quality of the scan, but the item is in no way attached to the background.. Payment We currently accept: Money orders Personal checks (must clear before shipping) Bank checks Billpoint Paypal If you are the winning bidder we will send you all the information you need after we receive the eBay "end of auction" confirmation email. International customers: Payment must be by money order drawn on U.S. bank funds. Shipping First class air mail shipping: U.S. ~ $1.95 Canada ~ $2.95 Europe ~ $3.95 Japan or Australia ~ $4.95 You may combine winning bids to save shipping. There is no additional shipping for sending more than one photo. Photos are shipped securely. In addition to movie and music promotional stills STARLIGHT offers a wide variety of rare and unique collectibles including: Promotional Press Kits, Photos and Cards Television and Film-related Toys and Action Figures Collectible Books and Magazines Posters Broadway Playbills NASA Items (we are based in Houston, "Space City" Texas) Please bookmark our eBay user ID and check our listings often! Item.Description: FIST OF FEAR TOUCH OF DEATH VHS Bruce Lee _ AKA Dragon and the Cobra . Based on the childhood of the famous kung-fu fighter Bruce Lee , this film follows the incidents that occurred at a martial arts competition in Madison Square Garden being held to determine Bruce Lee's successor. Was Bruce Lee murdered? Many feel that he revealed too much of Chinese Martial Arts history, including the Secret of the Vibrating Palm and the Touch of Death Principle . Will his successor suffer the same fate? Was Bruce's power hereditary? He was born under the same sign and on the same day as his great-grandfather, a Samurai-master swordsman of the 19th century. Perhaps this was an omen. Lots of fast-moving action with many film clips of Bruce Lee and his title championships are featured in this movie. Director: Matthew Mallinson . Starring: Fred Williamson, Ron Van Clief, Bruce Lee, Adolph Caesar, Aaron Banks, Teruyuki Higa . Violence, Not For Children. RATED: R . Running time: 90 min. Item.Name: Army of Darkness Ltd Edition 2 DVD #08111
Item.Description: Army of Darkness LE DVD OOP Factory Sealed. This is the Limited Edition version of Sam Raimi's Army of Darkness DVD in Mint Condition. It is a very rare 2 disc set including both the theatrical version and Raimi's Director's Cut. Only a total of 30,000 of these were produced and it is now out of print. This is numbered 08111 out of the first (and only!) printing of 30,000. Considered Raimi's greatest film, it stars Bruce Campbell as Ash, continuing his role from the Evil Dead films. It is the funniest horror films ever. The theatrical version disc includes: Widescreen presentation of the film Full-frame presentation The original ending Theatrical trailer Exclusive behind-the-scenes featurette "The Men Behind The Army" narrated by Bruce Campbell Talent bios. The Directors Cut DVD includes: The widescreen presentation 15 minutes of additional footage Audio commentary with Sam Raimi, star Bruce Campbell and co-writer Ivan Raimi 4 never before seen deleted scenes the director's storyboards. The DVDs are THX digitally remastered for superior sound and picture quality. The film was released in 1992. The Theatrical Cut runs 81 minutes, the Director's Cut is 96 minutes long. Item.Name: ANATOMY German Horror Franka Potente DVD
Item.Description: ANATOMY German Horror Franka Potente DVD From German comes this deft mixture of European sensibilities and the modern horror film. Paula (Potente of RUN LOLA RUN) is an ambitious German medical student who has recently gained acceptance into a top anatomy class in Heidelberg taught by a prestigious professor whom she has long idolized. Immersed in her studies, Paula is soon horrified to discover that several of her classmates have died under mysterious circumstances, and it is not long before she and a group of fellow classmates discover a secret society of students that regularly performs autopsies on live specimens! Filmed on location in Heidelberg, Germany. Stars Franka Potente (from Run Lola Run), Sebastian Blomberg, Benno Furmann, Holger Speckhahn, Anna Loos, Traugott Buhre DVD features: Commentary by director; TV spot(s); Storyboard comparisons; Deleted scenes; Music video; Make-up featurette; Making-of featurette; Production photos; Widescreen anamorphic format; Subtitled in English. Item.Name: I still Know What u did UK Quad Film Poster
Item.Description: I still Know What u did UK Quad Film Poster Original, mint condition, full colour 30" x 40" (76cm x 100cm) English promotional poster. This poster was printed by the film's promoter, in order to promote the 1999 release of the film , I still Know What you Did Last Summer (Directed by Neil H Moritz and Danny Cannon, staring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Freddie Prinze Jr, Brady, Mekhi Phifer, Muse Watson, Bill Cobbs and Matthew Settle and music by John Frizzell. The poster for sale here is in Mint/Unused condition. It has never been folded or displayed in any way. Dec 2nd 2001 : Holiday Shipping: We ship all orders with 2-3 business days from receipt of payment, and will continue to do so during this Holiday Season. For those customers who are bidding close to Christmas, we are offering the following guarantees: 1) All customers whose posters are shipped on the 17th,18th,19th & 20th of Dec. will be emailed a USPS tacking number the same day their poster is mailed 2) All Auctions that are paid in FULL by 2pm EST on Thursday December 20th 2001 will be mailed that same day, i.e. : If we get your payment on the 20th, your poster will ship that day, and a tracking number will be e-mailed to once it has been shipped. Our office will be CLOSED Friday Dec. 21st - Wednesday Dec. 26th, we will reopen at 10 am on Dec. 27th. About This Style of Poster: This is an promotional Outdoor Advertising poster which was printed to be pasted up around the streets of major English cities and towns. Please remember that this poster was printed in very limited quantity and few were left unused and in mint condition. You are bidding on an authentic promotional poster (NOT a reprint, copy or bootleg), an extremely rare and collectable piece of advertising memorabilia, which will undoubtedly make a valuable addition to your collection. Auction Images/Photographs: Some of the images that we use are taken with a digital camera, and as a result can contain some flash spots and/or appear blurred. In most cases the photograph does not do the poster justice. The poster itself is crystal clear, the images are sharp, the colors are vivid and all text is crisp and 100% legible. Postage & Delivery Information: Winners within the 50 United States, Canada and Mexico, will pay $ 6.00 for shipping via the USPS's Priority Mail Service. This price includes Web traceable USPS Delivery Confirmation for US buyers. You might think that this is expensive, however the stamp costs $ 3.50, Delivery Confirmation $ 0.40 and the plastic crush proof mailing tube costs $ 1.50. If you need your poster "Expressed", we will be more than happy to quote you a UPS "Red Label" rate. To ensure that you receive your poster promptly, we endevour to ship all orders within 2-3 business days of receipt of payment. International Orders are Welcome: Airmail Rates: (4-7 Business Days) Western Europe $ 9.00, South America $ 9.00, Pacific Rim $ 10.00. Express Mail Rates: (2-3 Business Days) Western Europe $ 26.00, South America $ 26.00, Pacific Rim $ 23.00. If your country is not listed in the groupings above, then please e-mail us, and we will be more than happy to provide you with the Airmail postage rate. How we pack and Ship Your Poster: Each poster that we sell is carefully rolled inside protective clear plastic sleeving then placed inside a custom cut length of indestructible PVC plumbing pipe. The pipe is then sealed closed on each end, addressed and is now ready to wing it 's way to you. Payment for your poster: We accept payment via; Paypal, US Postal Money Orders, International Bank drafts/cheques in US Dollars and International Postal Money Orders. We will accept payment in CASH in any local currency, but we advise that you send any CASH payments via Registered Mail. Please feel free to e-mail us with any questions that you might have. Remember to check out our other auctions for more rarities, as multiple orders will save on shipping!! Thank you for looking at this Auction, and best of luck. Item.Description: Coen Brothers BIG LEBOWSKI Movie Poster Mint! Click picture to enlarge Click picture to enlarge Click picture to enlarge Description THE BIG LEBOWSKI THE AWESOME US REGULAR ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER YOU ARE BIDDING ON THIS AWESOME MOVIE POSTER WHICH IS THE US REGULAR ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER AND IS IN MINT CONDITION, NEVER USED WITH SHARP EDGES AND CORNERS AND COMES ROLLED AND SHIPPED IN A PROTECTIVE TUBE (WE HAVE OVER 10 YEARS EXPERIENCE IN THE MAIL-ORDER BUSINESS SO BID WITH CONFIDENCE!!!). POSTER INFORMATION: THIS IS THE US ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER. IT MEASURES 27x40 (APPROX) AND IS AN ORIGINAL STUDIO RE-ISSUED MOVIE POSTER (NOT A POSTER-HOUSE REPRINT!!!). When the studios started to realize there was a mass market for their movie posters, they have gone back and re-issued several of them. This poster is one of them. It is identical to the first printing done by the studio. Only an appraiser could probably tell the difference. Now, as far as collectability goes, to give you an example - First printings for BIG LEBOWSKI posters sell for about $100 each (if you can even find one). The studio realized that this was not appropriate for the average person who wanted the poster for their wall and so they went back and re-issued the poster in mass quantity and so the value of the re-issues is not like the first printings, yet you get basically the same quality. This provides an affordable alternative for someone to obtain a poster for a movie like THE BIG LEBOWSKI. Again, this is NOT a poster-house reprint. Those are photocopies of the originals and the quality is not nearly as good. I offer a complete satisfaction guarantee on all my products!!! Item.Name: David Bowie Life Mask MAN WHO FELL TO EARTH
Item.Location: The Haunted Studios at Birch Hollow Farm
Item.Description: The David Bowie Life Mask Ziggy Stardust Spiders from Mars science fiction sci-fi lifecast life cast lifemask We are proud to announce that Haunted Studios Life Masks have been selected exclusively by Seattle's Pacific Science Center Museum for its exhibit on 3D art, making our castings "officially" museum quality. This is an authentic cast, made from a rare life mask of the multi talented David Bowie for his appearance in the cult classic film THE MAN WHO FELL TO EARTH . Here is an excellent casting, showing all of the detail of this 'young' David Bowie, right down to his teeth behind open lips! The detail is so fine on this mask, you expect David to open his mouth and sing for you! You can buy from our collection with confidence, we are the original life mask collectors on with satisfied customers around the world! You can spend more for a life mask elsewhere, but why not buy the best mask at the best price? Ken Patterson's Haunted Studios are proud members of The Association of Lifecasters International . This life mask is one of a limited edition produced by Studio 303, and comes with a certificate of authenticity, making it the perfect gift or collection centerpiece. This mask is equipped with a sturdy wire hanger on the back for fast, easy wall mounting. Your complete satisfaction with this Life Mask is UNCONDITIONALLY GUARANTEED. This mask is cast in UltraStone_, Studio 303's exclusive compound that combines superior strength and detail rendering characteristics. These were the BEST QUALITY masks we could find. Now this superb life mask can be yours, from one collector to another. This life mask makes a perfect 'before' piece to display next to our life mask of David Bowie with the 'old age vampire' make up from the film The Hunger. If you have any questions about this item please contact me at ken@hauntedstudios.com and I'll get back to you ASAP. The life mask is life size, cast in UltraStone_, and comes ready to hang on your wall in a "Antique Gold and Bronze" finish. Included is a Certificate of Authenticity from Studio 303. More than just painted, each mask is hand finished by a retired Hollywood film studio prop builder. Our original finishing process is often imitated, b ut never equaled! Masks are sealed, painted with four metallic colors to bring out the detail, the sealed again to last a lifetime. Winning bidder to pay $12.50 USPS Priority Mail shipping, insurance, and handling to any United States destination for this item. Your life mask will be shipped with all new packing materials in a new, strong shipping box. For your protection and the safety of your purchase we never reuse packing boxes or cushioning materials. We are sorry, but due to recent losses from foreign Non Paying Bidders, Overseas Postal Services, and convoluted customs issues and insurance claims WE ARE CURRENTLY ONLY SHIPPING TO UNITED STATES ADDRESSES. As these are strictly Limited Editions, each life mask is sent to you in its own new shipping box with all new packing materials to protect your purchase. We are sorry, but each life mask must be shipped in its own box, we can not ship more than one item per box. Insured Federal Express can be substituted for USPS Priority Mail at additional cost and will be quoted on an individual basis. We are sorry, but at this time we are only shipping to United States addresses. We welcome the use of both eBay Payments and Paypal for credit cards and online checks. For eBay Payments with your Visa , MasterCard , or Discover card, just click on the Pay Now icon located at the top of this page at auction's end . If you prefer PayPal follow the PayPal Instant Purchase link below this description at auction's end. At auction end we will notify the winning bidder within three hours. Personal checks are always welcome, but please allow 10 days for clearing or send money order for faster shipping. Item.Name: The Thing Signature Coll WS AC-3 THX Fac-Sld
Item.Description: if( navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if( navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://members.aol.com/laserdiscs2go/backgroundxxxx.gif) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { // use netscape style background statement document.write(" "); } Rare Factory-Sealed AC-3 / Dolby Digital THX Certified Special Laserdisc Edition John Carpenter's The Thing The Signature Collection (WS) (1978) (THX) (Extras) [images are actual] dts Pretty in Pink LASERDISC brat pack 70's 1970's 1970 rare widescreen Molly Ringwald ld ws _ Detail Summary: The Thing 1982 - USA - 108 min. - Feature, Color Director: John Carpenter Genre/Type: Horror, Science Fiction, Sci-Fi Horror, Alien Invasion Films, Monster Film MPAA Rating: R Box office: Domestic gross: $13,800,000 From story by: Campbell, John W. Jr. From story: Who Goes There? Set In: Arctic Color type: Technicolor Cinematic Process: Panavision Produced by: Universal Description: John Carpenter's The Thing is both a remake of Howard Hawks' 1951 film of the same name and a re-adaptation of the John W. Campbell Jr. story "Who Goes There?" on which it was based. Carpenter's film is more faithful to Campbell's story than Hawks' version and also substantially more reliant on special effects, provided in abundance by a team of over 40 technicians, including veteran creature-effects artists Rob Bottin and Stan Winston. The film opens enigmatically with a Siberian Husky running through the Antarctic tundra, chased by two men in a helicopter firing at it from above. Even after the dog finds shelter at an American research outpost, the men in the helicopter (Norwegians from an outpost nearby) land and keep shooting. One of the Norwegians drops a grenade and blows himself and the helicopter to pieces; the other is shot dead in the snow by Garry (Donald Moffat) the American outpost captain. American helicopter pilot MacReady (Kurt Russell, fresh from Carpenter's Escape From New York) and camp doctor Copper (Richard Dysart) fly off to find the Norwegian base and discover some pretty strange goings-on. The base is in ruins, and the only occupants are a man frozen to a chair (having cut his own throat) and the burned remains of what could be one man or several men. In a side room, Copper and MacReady find a coffin-like block of ice from which something has been recently cut.... That night at the American base, the Husky changes into the Thing, and the Americans learn first-hand that the creature has the ability to mutate into anything it kills. For the rest of the film the men fight a losing (and very gory) battle against it, never knowing if one of their own dwindling number is the Thing in disguise. Though resurrected as a cult favorite, The Thing failed at the box office during its initial run, possibly because of its release just two weeks after Steven Spielberg's warmly received E.T.: The Extraterrestrial. Along with Ridley Scott's futuristic Alien, The Thing helped stimulate a new wave of sci/fi horror films in which action and special effects wizardry were often seen as ends in themselves. ? Anthony Reed This remake of the 1950s classic is primarily a showcase for the gory special effects of Rob Bottin. Dogs are ripped open by tentacled beasts, people's faces stretch to inhuman dimensions, and all sorts of bloody mayhem ensues, while the cast stands around covered with ice crystals and sniping at each other. There are a few creepy moments, but most of them result in another of Bottin's admittedly amazing creations. If you like gore and can often be seen reading Fangoria magazine, this is a must-see. If, on the other hand, your preference is for more subtle horror (or even character development), you may want to look elsewhere. ? Robert Firsching Starring: Kurt Russell - MacReady Wilford Brimley - Blair T.K. Carter - Nauls David Clennon - Palmer Keith David - Childs Richard Dysart - Dr. Copper Charles Hallahan - Norris Peter Maloney - Bennings Richard Masur - Clark Joel Polis - Fuchs Norbert Weisser - Norwegian Larry J. Franco - Norwegian Passenger with Rifle Jerry Wills Rock Walker Clint Rowe Thomas G. Waites - Windows William Zeman - Pilot Kent Hays Larry Holt Tony Cecere Donald Moffat - Garry Denver Mattson Nate Irwin - Helicopter Pilot Eric Mansker Melvin Jones Crew: David Foster - Producer Larry J. Franco - Producer / First Assistant Director Lawrence Turman - Producer John Carpenter - Screenwriter / Director Mick Garris - Screenwriter Bill Lancaster - Screenwriter Dean Cundey - Cinematographer Ennio Morricone - Composer (Music Score) Todd Ramsay - Editor John J. Lloyd - Production Designer Henry Larrecq - Art Director Stuart Cohen - Co-producer John M. Dwyer - Set Designer Graeme Murray - Set Designer Roy Arbogast - Special Effects Michael Clifford - Special Effects Albert J. Whitlock - Special Effects Raymond Stella - Camera Operator Thomas D. Causey - Sound/Sound Designer Rob Bottin - Makeup Special Effects Money Orders or Personal Checks or PAYPAL or BIDPAY accepted Buyer [with USA shipping address] pays flat $7.00 for shipping [usps priority or ups / delivery tracking and confirmation & insurance included] NON US BUYERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY AND ALL FEES/CHARGES [BANK/TRANSACTION/TAX ETC] WHICH ARE A RESULT OF NEGOTIATING THE INSTRUMENT OF PAYMENT note: BIDDERS WITHOUT A USA OR USA TERRITORY ADDRESS PAY ACTUAL SHIPPING COSTS PLUS AN ADDITIONAL 3 DOLLAR HANDLING FEE Please look at my other auctions/Save on shipping by bidding on multiple items Add $1.50 per each additional single disc title; 2.00 per double disc title; additional boxset rates will be calculated at 2.00 per disc contained. The total payment may also include reimbursement to the seller for shipping and handling costs. 4. If you have questions - contact the seller fresher1701 before you bid. 5. Place your bid! 6. Item.Name: Angus Scrimm Phantasm Life Mask 1996 Casting
Item.Location: The Haunted Studios at Birch Hollow Farm
Item.Description: The Angus Scrimm Life Mask lifecast life cast lifemask Here is a rare Haunted Studios Life Mask from 1996 that we are finally able to offer again, for a limited time only. This is an authentic cast, made from a rare life mask of cult Horror Icon Angus Scrimm (The Tall Man) that we acquired from a private collector in the Midwest section of the United States. This masks shows every detail of the face that haunted our dreams in each of the four Phantasm horror films! Now we are offering this rare and unique item on exclusively. You can buy from our collection with confidence, we are the original life mask collectors on with satisfied customers around the world! This numbered and limited edition cast comes with a certificate of authenticity, making it the perfect gift or collection centerpiece. Your complete satisfaction with this Life Mask is UNCONDITIONALLY GUARANTEED. Ken Patterson's Haunted Studios are proud members of The Association of Lifecasters International . These were the BEST QUALITY masks we could find, as you can see from the photo to the right. Now this rare, superb life mask can be yours, from one collector to another. Life Masks were used to develop make up appliances that would be used on Angus Scrimm in each of the Phantasm films. Now you can own the face of horror from a classic series of motion pictures, a truly rare collectible that will highlight any collection! THIS IS THE FACE OF ONE OF THE GREATEST CULT HORROR STARS OF ALL TIME! Our original finishing process is often imitated, but never equaled! The life mask is life size, cast in UltraStone_, and comes ready to hang on your wall in a "Antique Gold and Bronze" finish. More than just painted, each mask is hand finished by a retired Hollywood film studio prop builder. Included is a Certificate of Authenticity from Studio 303. Don't miss out on this opportunity to own a piece of motion picture history that is also a true work of art. If you have any questions about this item please contact me at ken@hauntedstudios.com and I'll get back to you ASAP. Thanks for taking a look! Winning bidder to pay $14.75 USPS Priority Mail shipping, insurance, and handling to any United States destination for this heavy item. Item.Name: Alfred Hitchcock Life Mask Rare EYES OPEN
Item.Location: The Haunted Studios at Birch Hollow Farm
Item.Description: Alfred Hitchcock Life Mask lifecast life cast lifemask A life mask so rare it was believed not to exist! This extremely rare life mask shows a much younger Alfred Hitchcock, with his eyes sculpted open by the Universal Studios make up department. The original that this mask was cast from was purchased from a retired Universal Studios employee. That original mask hung on the wall of a studio office for many years, but 'retired' when our source did! I don't know exactly when or why the original mask was taken, but comparing it with our 'older' Hitchcock life mask you can see that here his face is much more youthful, not suffering the effects of gravity nearly as much. His lip line is also much stronger in this mask, showing the trade mark pouting lower lip. This numbered and limited edition cast is an exact image of the youthful face of one of the cinema's greatest directors. This is Mr. Hitchcock's face as it looked early in his career. You can buy from our collection with confidence, we are the original life mask collectors on with satisfied customers around the world! You can spend more for a life mask elsewhere, but why not buy the best mask at the best price? We are proud to announce that Haunted Studios Life Masks have been selected exclusively by Seattle's Pacific Science Center Museum for its exhibit on 3D art, making our castings "officially" museum quality. This cast comes with a certificate of authenticity from Studio 303, making it the perfect gift or collection centerpiece. This mask is equipped with a sturdy wire hanger on the back for fast, easy wall mounting. Your complete satisfaction with this Life Mask is UNCONDITIONALLY GUARANTEED by The Haunted Studios_. Ken Patterson's Haunted Studios are proud members of The Association of Lifecasters International . This mask is cast in UltraStone_, Studio 303's exclusive compound that combines superior strength and detail rendering characteristics. These are the BEST QUALITY masks we have found, anywhere. Now this superb life mask can be yours, from one collector to another. Don't miss out on this rare opportunity. We have never offered this mask for sale anywhere prior to this offering. The life mask is life size, cast in UltraStone_, and comes ready to hang on your wall in a "Antique Gold and Bronze" finish. Included is a Certificate of Authenticity from Studio 303. Don't miss out on this opportunity to own a piece of motion picture history that is also a true work of art. Our original finishing process is often imitated, but never equaled! More than just painted, each mask is hand finished by a retired Hollywood film studio prop builder. Masks are sealed, painted with four metallic colors to bring out the detail, the sealed again to last a lifetime. If you have any questions about this item please contact me at ken@hauntedstudios.com and I'll get back to you ASAP. Thanks for taking a look! Item.Name: Halloween II DVD Jamie Lee Curtis
Item.Description: Halloween II is a new DVD in excellent condition as is the original case. Bought New. Viewed once. Stars: Jamie Lee Curtis,Donald Pleasence... Color/Rated R/93 minutes...Halloween was a breakthrough independent boxoffice hit for writer-director-composer John Carpenter and star Jamie Lee Curtis. It also introduced one of the most memorable modern-day movie monsters in the shape of escaped psychopath Michael Myers, who is relentlessly pursued by Dr. Sam Loomis. Presented in its original widescreen format to preserve all the terror, director Rick Rosenthal's sequel picks up right where the original left off, reuniting Curtis, Pleasence, and writer-producer Carpenter. Find out what happened next on "the night he came home," as Michael pursues Laurie Strode into a new bloodbath at the hospital, while Dr. Loomis frantically tries to understand-and destroy-him. Buyer to pay $2.75 s&h.

Item.Name: The Bobby Allison Racing Story
Item.Description: This is a 1992 VHS Five Points Productions Video, still wrapped, untouched, snuggly, in the shrinkwrap, mint condition, boldly autographed with Bobby Allison's signature. I have seen other videos exactly like this one, without the signature, I have few other copies like this one, with the signature, none of the signatures are exactly alike. What I am saying, is, you can tell the signatures belong to Bobby Allison, but they certainly do not look like they were factory stamped identically, each one perfect like the other signatures. In other works, it looks like he signed each video jacket! I am not saying he did. I have no verification to back that fact up. As I said before, no two signatures look as though they ere perfectly stamped from a factory stamp. The jacket cover was created by artist, Tony Comtec. The use of red, white, and blue were the primary colors of choice for the jacket cover, on back of cover is full length picture of his pride and joy Number 12 Buick race car, with Miller High Life endorsements, painted gold. Bobby Allison named this film, High Banks and Fast Turns. On front of video jacket is drawing of Bobby holding one of his all time famous trophies and cheering on the races. This is by all means a collector's choice video of the late great race car driver, Bobby Allison. Please view my feedbacks, recent auctions, feel with confidence to bid on this magnificent video, still in shrink wrap, mint condition. I accept paypal, money orders, cashiers checks, no personal checks, please, nor do I accept U.S. currency through the U.S. mail. Thank you for looking. Thank you for bidding. P.S. I go to the U.S. post office every day, to secure delivery for Christmas.

Item.Name: Once Upon A Time In China 2-New DVD-Jet Li
Item.Description: Once Upon A Time In China 2 This is an All Codes Brand New SEALED DVD. Director: Tsui Hark. Action Director: Yuen Wo-Ping (THE MATRIX) Starring: Jet Li, Max Mok, Rosamund Kwan, Donnie Yen, David Chiang, Xiong Xin-Xin, Cheung Tit-Lam, and Paul Fonoroff. The even more spectacular sequel to the adventures and exploits of one of China's greatest heroes. The year is 1895, a troubled time for Imperial China. At a medical convention in Canton, the legendary Wong Fey Hong befriends Dr. Sun Yat Sen. Witnessing riots stirred up by the White Lotus clan, which is determined to wipe out all foreigners and their influence in China, Wong and Sun Yat Sen intervene. Wong and Sun defeat the Clan, but military troops surround them before they can make good their escape. The climactic final confrontation is one of the most spectacular action scenes ever filmed. Dolby Digital Stereo AC-3 ALL CODES so that it is playable worldwide!!! In Mandarin soundtracks with optional Chinese and English subtitles. Item.Description: Custer of the West is a spectacular production based on the tumultuous story of the hero who became a legend, General George Custer (Robert Shaw). From hit-making producer Jerry Bruckheimer (Gone In 60 Seconds, Armageddon) comes Coyote Ugly, the intoxicating sexy comedy starring an unbeatable cast of hot, new stars including Piper Perabo (Rocky And Bullwinkle) and Maria Bello (Payback). Moving to New York to pursue her dream of becoming a famous songwriter, Violet Sanford (Perabo) finds herself desperate and broke. Through a twist of fate, the shy, innocent Violet lands a job as one of the barmaids at the hottest nightclub in town -- the down and dirty, wild and fun Coyote Ugly. Pouring drinks and overflowing with attitude, the "Coyotes" spend more time on top of the bar than behind it, tantalizing the standing-room-only crowd with their outrageous antics! It's one wild adventure for a small-town girl chasing her dream in the big city. Love sex and intelligence The trio which comprised Sublime vocalist/guitarist Nowell, bassist Eric Wilson and drummer Bud Gaugh played their first gig on the 4th of July 1988 at a small Long Beach club (a show which sparked the infamous Peninsula Riot). The group began aggressively touring around the area with an increasingly substantial following, especially among the surf/skate beach crowd. After four years of concentrating strictly on live shows, Sublime's first album (40 Oz. to Freedom) was recorded in 1992. The LP was released on Skunk Records the label formed by Nowell with Sublime manager Miguel and sold at shows, but really started to break when KROQ began playing the single "Date Rape" two years after its initial release. Item.Name: Cat Ballou (1965) Oscar Winner LEE MARVIN Sig
Item.Description: Cat Ballou (1965) Oscar Winner LEE MARVIN Sig Vintage autograph acquired during the golden age of Hollywood! Signed, with brief inscription, on a sheet measuring approximately 4 _" x 6"; removed from the pages of a vintage autograph book. In very good condition. *OWN A PIECE OF HOLLYWOOD HISTORY* NO RESERVE. GUARANTEED AUTHENTIC Lee Marvin Date of birth 19 February 1924, New York, New York, USA Date of death 29 August 1987, Tucson, Arizona, USA. (heart attack) Biography for Lee Marvin[? Height 6' 3" Mini biography Prematurely white-haired character star who began as a supporting player of generally vicious demeanor, then metamorphosed into a star of both action and drama projects. Born in New York City to Lamont Marvin, an advertising executive, and his wife Courtenay, a fashion writer, the young Marvin was thrown out of dozens of schools for incorrigibility. His parents took him to Florida, where he attended St. Leo's Preparatory School near Dade City. Dismissed there as well, he enlisted in the U.S. Marines at the beginning of World War II. In the battle of Saipan in June 1944, he was wounded in the buttocks by Japanese fire which severed his sciatic nerve. He was invalided home and got menial work as a plumber's apprentice in Woodstock, New York. While repairing a toilet at the local community theatre, he was asked to replace an ailing actor in a rehearsal. He was immediately stricken with a love for the theatre and went to New York City, where he studied and played small roles in stock and Off-Broadway. He landed an extra role in Henry Hathaway's U.S.S. Teakettle, and found his role expanded when Hathaway took a liking to him. Returning to the stage, he made his Broadway debut in Billy Budd, and after a long succession of small TV roles, moved to Hollywood, where he began playing heavies and cops in roles of increasing size and frequency. Given a leading role in Eight Iron Men, he followed it with enormously memorable heavies in The Big Heat and The Wild One. Now established as a major screen villain, Marvin began shifting toward leading roles with a successful run as a police detective in the TV series 'M Squad'. A surprise Oscar for his dual role as a drunken gunfighter and his evil, noseless brother in the Western comedy Cat Ballou placed him in the upper tiers of Hollywood leading men, and he filled out his career with predominantly action-oriented films. A long-term romantic relationship with Michelle Triola led, after their breakup, to a highly publicized lawsuit in which Triola asked for a substantial portion of Marvin's assets. Her case failed in its main pursuit, but did establish a legal precedent for the rights of unmarried cohabitors, the so-called "palimony" law. Marvin continued making films of varying quality, always as a star, until his sudden death from a heart attack in 1987. Spouse 'Pamela Feeley' (18 October 1970 - 29 August 1987) (his death) 'Betty Ebeling' (February 1951 - 5 January 1967) (divorced) Trivia Says he learned to "act" in the Marines, trying to act unafraid during ferocious combat, which brought him a Purple Heart during invasion of Saipan. The body of Lee Marvin was interred next to that of Joe Louis in Arlington National Cemetery, Arlington, Va. USA. Son Christopher born 1952. Daughter Courtenay born 1954. Daughter Cynthia born 1956. Daughter Claudia born 1958. Was a direct descendant of both George Washington and Thomas Jefferson. Was Spielberg's first choice for the role of Quint in Jaws (1975). Personal quotes "Tequila. Straight. There's a real polite drink. You keep drinking until you finally take one more and it just won't go down. Then you know you've reached your limit." Upon accepting his Best Actor Academy Award for "Cat Ballou," 1966: "I think half of this belongs to a horse somewhere out in the valley." Biography from Leonard Maltin's Movie Encyclopedia: Rugged actor who, like many tough-looking leading men, started his movie career as a heavy, then graduated to heroic roles when he became a star. Marvin, a WW2 veteran, took up acting in the late 1940s following an unfulfilling stint as a plumber. Initially appearing in summer stock and off-Broadway productions, he graduated to the Great White Way in 1951. That same year, he broke into movies with a bit part in You're in the Navy Now and two years later achieved recognition as the psychopathic gang leader who hurled scalding coffee in his girlfriend's face in The Big Heat (1953). Marvin also played a rival gangleader in The Wild One (1954), a nasty townsman in Bad Day at Black Rock a burned-out jazzman in Pete Kelly's Blues (both 1955), and Western baddies in Gun Fury, The Stranger Wore a Gun (both in 1953), Seven Men From Now (1956), and The Comancheros (1961). After starring for three seasons on the TV cop show "M Squad" (1957-60), he reached his apex as a big-screen bad guy playing the whipcracking terror of John Ford's The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962), which starred John Wayne and James Stewart. Following the lighthearted Donovan's Reef (1963, again for Ford), Marvin returned to form as the contract killer who guns down crime boss Ronald Reagan (in his last film) in The Killers (1964). He followed that with a memorable turn as a washed-up ball player in Ship of Fools (1965). Next came the Western spoof Cat Ballou (also 1965); Marvin's dual role as a drunken gunslinger and a tin-nosed desperado won him an Oscar and elevated him to leading-man status. He maintained it by heading up two all-star action blockbusters, The Professionals (1966) and The Dirty Dozen (1967), and for the next 20 years gave solid performances in such varied films as the quirky thriller Point Blank (1967), the two-man war movie Hell in the Pacific (1968), the big-budget musical Paint Your Wagon (1969), the elegiac Western Monte Walsh (1970), the satiric gangster opus Prime Cut (1972), the allegorical train adventure Emperor of The North (1973), the comic Western Great Scout and Cathouse Thursday (1976), and Sam Fuller's autobiographical war film, The Big Red One (1980), which gave him one of his all-time best parts as an indomitable sergeant in the infantry. Later films include Death Hunt (1980), Gorky Park (1983), The Delta Force (1986), and a TV movie sequel The Dirty Dozen: The Next Mission (1985). Perhaps his most underrated work was his performance as Hickey in the 1973 film adaptation of Eugene O'Neill's The Iceman Cometh Marvin also left a legacy of quite a different sort: his longtime companion, Michelle Triola, successfully sued him for support after their breakup, bringing the word "palimony" into the American lexicon. Item.Name: SYLVIA (1965) CAROLL BAKER DRAMA ONE SHEET
Item.Description: JonWarren.com proudly presents... SYLVIA (1965) CAROLL BAKER DRAMA ONE SHEET SYLVIA (1965) CAROLL BAKER DRAMA ONE SHEET Original One Sheet from the 1965 drama starring Carroll Baker, George Maharis. Distributed by Paramount. National Screen Service ID 65/60. Printed in two color on stock paper and measures 27 in. w. X 41 in. h; folded as issued. Grade description: Never-Used. Excellent condition. (C8) No pin holes, tears, tape or other flaws, although very minor wear may be evident due to long-term storage. Grade: C8 using the Warren Grading Scale for movie posters. This is the authentic theater movie poster, not a reprint or video release. Authentic movie posters are scarce, because they were printed in small quantities for distribution to theaters and were never intended to be sold to the general public. You will be buying from Jon R. Warren, author of Warren's Movie Poster Price Guide (NOW ONLINE AT IGUIDEdotNET) and a leading expert in the field of movie posters. Satisfaction Guaranteed! Item.Name: SOTHEBY'S Chinese Export & W.O.A. 1996!
Item.Description: Cover Lot: A Magnificient and Extremely Rare biscuit figure of a Tiger, Qing dynasty, Kangxi period. Estimate _120,00-170,000 CHINESE EXPORT AND WORKS OF ART: Sotheby_s LONDON 12 November, 1996. Sale LN6661 A beautiful soft cover catalogue, with 252 lots, displayed wonderfully within 66 heavy stock glossy, mainly coloured pages. Each lot described in great detail, including several examples of various decorations and forms of export b&w and polychrome porcelain, of both Ming and Qing dynasties. There are many lots of armorial, documentary, subject dishes and other table ware. Also many porcelain animal figures and examples of pieces in ivory and lacquer furniture. A few HIGHLIGHTS: A rare B&W FLASK, Wanli period, c. 1610. (_4,000-6,000) An extremely rare gilt-decorated green enamel KENDI, Ming dynasty, 16th century. (_5,000-7,000) A fine and impressive VASE, Kangxi period. (16,000-20,000) A large _rose-verte_ Armorial CHARGER, Yongzheng period. (_4,000-6,000) A pair of BOTANICAL plates, Qianlong period, c.1740. (_4,000-6,000) A rare Canton Enamel SUPPER SET, Qianlong period. (_5,000-7,000) A finely painted pair of FLASKS and COVERS, Yongzheng period. (_10,000-15,000) A fine pair of RUBY-GROUND CHARGERS, Yongzheng period. (_8,000-12,000) An eight-fold Coromandel LACQUER SCREEN, Yongzheng period, c. 1731. (_6,000-8,000) OUT-OF-PRINT. AN EXCELLENT REFERENCE BOOK! With hardly any wear. Approx. 8 1/2 x 11". Estimates in _ (pounds) http://www.currency.co.nz/. (for currency conversion). In 1996 prices! Email me with your questions! Item.Description: Hi.....Here are 2 NEW, UNUSED One Sheet Reproductions, 11 by 14 inches, printed on acid-free paper using the latest laser technology of two films of the 3 STOOGES....Titles are IDIOTS DELUXE and A DUCKING THEY DID GO......Columbia Pictures 2 reel comedies.........All Shown............SUPER Colorful, Clear Images!.......Reproductions like this are a convenient and inexpensive way to collect expensive and hard to find images......VERY LOW $2.50 EACH OPENING BID PRICE FOR EACH.........Usually $15.00 each!...You will find few reproductions at a lower opening price and NONE with such clarity and detail.....AND ....I will also include as a BONUS an 8 1/2 by 11 inch b&w Studio Glossy Reprint Printout on regular paper of a collage of GREAT STARS...from CHARLIE CHAPLIN to MAE WEST....I am sure you can tell the other stars when you see the jpg....If you have received this BONUS before I will substitute another..........All Framable.....though I store/display mine in plastic sleeved 3 ring binders.......ALL for one winning bid/buy!..... A GREAT Gift Set for yourself or someone else who will appreciate it as well as a Great Collectable.......CLEAR, CRISP, IMAGE's!.....NOT like my JPG's....ANY distortion or streaking on the image is on the image NOT on the item......JPG's are sometimes out of proportion...Larger items look smaller....Please check dimensions in description......Shipped $5.00 Priority.............$10.00 for Foreign........I will gladly combine wins to save on Shipping and Handling ......NEVER a RESERVE on ANY of the items that I have up......I believe reserves are unfair to bidders......The opening price is the reserve.......so if interested you might consider Bookmarking my Seller's Lists........ ........ Many Thanks!....Good Luck!....and Happy Auctioning!....Dick Clark...The retired teacher from the Mid-Hudson Valley not the guy who stands out in the cold in Times Square on NEW YEAR'S EVE. :-)

Item.Name: ICONS MIB Men In Black NOISY CRICKET Prop Gun
Item.Description: Bid with confidence. We are certified eBay Power Sellers. Auction is for one M.I.B. THE NOISY CRICKET. This is an authentic 1/1 scale masterpiece replica from ICONS AUTHENTIC REPLICAS. This pistol has a pressure sensitive triggerwhich illuminates a green L.E.D.( light emitting diode) powered by a long lasting alkaline battery. Beautiful custom polished nickel finish and resin plastic handgrips. Limited Edition of 5,000 pieces, but from our estimate less were actually produced. A truly rare piece that is OUT OF PRODUCTION and metal cast directly from molds taken off the Noisy Cricket used by Will Smith's character Agent J in the hit film. If you are not aware Icons is "no more". This piece was custom fabricated by a master special effects artisian, using the same techniques and materials used in making the original. Item is in mint condition. This beautiful museum quality piece comes with a fantastic glossy metal display plaque, Certificate Of Authenticity (COA) and a museum quality plexi-glass display case. It ships in a sturdy shipping container which is custom fitted with foam and is extremely secure. Please see our other auctions for the Endoskeleton TERMINATOR 2 Judgment Day ENDOARM & ENDOSKULL from T-2, Star Wars BEN OBI-WAN KENOBI Lightsaber, The NAUTILUS from Jules Verne & Walt Disney's 20,000 Leagues Under The Sea and the PREDATOR HELMET. All Icons Authentic Replicas are made in the U.S.A. and developed and fabricated by professional motion picture and television artisians whose professional credits include STAR TREK VOYAGER and DEEP SPACE: NINE, BATMAN AND ROBIN, BABYLON 5, THE ABYSS, THE ROCKETEER, XENA, TOTAL RECALL, and QUANTUM LEAP just to name a few. Each replica is guaranteed authentic and is OFFICIALLY LICENSED, authorized, and authenticated by the studio that produced the film or T.V. program in which the prop or miniature was originally seen. QUESTIONS: Each item is described to the best of our ability and we have done our best to include as much information as possible about this item. If you have any further questions please email us at dkeincsales@aol.com We will do our best to answer your questions. Please include item number and description with all emails. Item.Name: BUFFY call sheet from the set!!!!!
Item.Description: This is a call sheet from the set of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. This sheet includes which scenes were shot that day (this particular call sheet is from Nov. 21, 2001), a list of each cast member that worked that day, what time each cast member needed to report to makeup, rehearsal, and set, the location where each scene was shot, and the list of all the crew members and what time their call was for that day. It also lists the scenes that were to be shot for the next five days. This is a great collector's item for the Buffy fan. I take ebay payments and paypal, and will charge $2.00 shipping. Item.Name: Film book ROOSTER COGBURN John Wayne
Item.Description: [[ [ MOVIE EDITION PAPERBACK BOOKS ROOSTER COGBURN Written by Martin Julien is based on the movie starring John Wayne Catherine Hepburn PUBLISHED October 1975 16 page B&W photo section I BEGAN COLLECTING MOVIE AND TV-EDITION PAPERBACK BOOKS AS AN OUTGROWTH OF MY INTEREST IN FILM AND TELEVISION. I WAS FASCINATED BY HOW MANY MOVIES, EVEN VERY SMALL SHORT RELEASE FILMS, HAD A BOOK PUBLISHED TO TIE IN TO IT. THEN TOO THERE ARE BOOKS WHICH ARE MADE INTO FILMS FOR WHICH A DIFFERENT EDITION IS PUBLISHED FOR THE FILM WHEN IT COMES OUT. SOME THESE MOVIE OR TELEVISION EDITION PAPERBACK BOOKS CAN BE QUITE RARE FOR A NUMBER OF REASONS [ THE BOOKS HAD SHORT PRINT RUNS TO BEGIN WITH, AND IN THE CASE OF OLDER FILMS NOT MANY OF THE MOVIE BOOKS MAY HAVE BEEN PRESERVED OVER THE YEARS.....A PUBLISHER WENT OUT OF BUSINESS JUST AS A BOOK WAS BEING PRINTED ......A BOOK MAY HAVE ONLY BEEN PUBLISHED IN GREAT BRITAIN ....OR A FILM JUST MAY NOT HAVE BEEN WELL APPRECIATED IN ITS TIME SO MOST OF THE BOOKS WENT UNSOLD AND WERE SUBSEQUENTLY DESTROYED] All books are in good condition. I'm picky about my paperbacks so if it's not a book I would want in my own collection ( well, actually, it is in my own collection ) I wouldn't have bought it in the first place. All books are shipped in archive storage plastic paperback bags I am listing hundreds of hard to find movie edition paperback books this week. If there is a particular actor or actress you collect on and would like to see if I am offering any materials from films they were in, click on the eBay "SEARCH" tab at the top of this page and in the space where it says SEARCH TITLE enter the words: is based on the movie starring and then enter the name of the actor or actress you're interested in. Click the box that says SEARCH TITLE AND DESCRIPTION directly beneath and then hit the SEARCH button. You will then get a listing of all the materials I currently have listed featuring that person. Have questions? Click here to email me. Notification email will be sent to you after auction close. Confirmation appreciated upon your receipt of your notification of the win. * * * * * * * Depending on where you live, the following are the terms for completing this transaction: TO BUYERS IN THE UNITED STATES: SHIPPING OF THIS ITEM IS $5.00 FOR USPS PRIORITY MAIL WITH DELIVERY CONFIRMATION TRACKING. INSURANCE IS UP TO THE BUYER AND COSTS $1.10 PAYMENT BY MONEY ORDER OR THROUGH PAYPAL OR BIDPAY. THE SHIPPING FEE IS $5.00 TO ANYWHERE IN THE US NO MATTER HOW MANY ITEMS YOU PURCHASE TO BUYERS IN CANADA: SHIPPING OF THIS ITEM IS $5.00 FOR AIRMAIL SERVICE AND I DO FILL OUT ALL CUSTOMS DECLARATION FORMS REQUIRED. PAYMENT BY MONEY ORDER OR THROUGH PAYPAL OR BIDPAY. TO CANADA IT IS $5.00 FOR THE FIRST BOOK AND $1.00 FOR EACH ADDITIONAL TITLE FOR SHIPPING ACROSS THE BORDER TO BUYERS ANYWHERE ELSE: SHIPPING OF THIS ITEM IS $9.00 FOR GLOBAL PRIORITY MAIL. I USE THE FLAT RATE ENVELOPE WHICH CAN FIT UP TO FOUR REGULAR PAPERBACK BOOKS FOR THE $9.00 FEE. PAYMENT FROM BUYERS OUTSIDE OF THE US & CANADA MUST BE THROUGH PAYPAL OR BIDPAY ONLY. PLEASE WRITE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON EXACT SHIPPING. I DO FILL OUT ALL CUSTOMS DECLARATION FORMS REQUIRED. I DO NOT ACCEPT BILLPOINT - Ebay Online Payments eBay's most successful sellers use Auctionworks sales management services! Item.Name: GODFATHER II Script +RareBonus! Coppola Oscar
Item.Description: GODFATHER II script + rare bonus! Coppola OSCAR Amazing Oscar winning screenplay to landmark film THE GODFATHER II + rare Bonus material! This is the 2nd draft dated September 26, 1973 co-written by Francis Ford Coppola and the novel's author- the late great Mario Puzo. Contains interesting scenes not found in the film. This is the script for the sequel/prequel that some claim is better than the original Godfather. I am also including RARE BONUS material: Copies of a LETTER from Mario Puzo to Coppola detailing Puzo's thoughts on certain elements from this draft of the script and the direction he thought they should take (6 pages!) ALSO, copies of a memo detailing/comparing the salaries of the stars from the first Godfather to the sequel!! This stuff is amazing to learn from if not simply awesome memorablia that's virtually impossible to find. Great gift to complement the recently released DVD collection. The script is in standard industry format(previously copied), 3 hole punched with brass fasteners Priority shipping with delivery confirmation is $4.95 US Post office in states. However, use "buy it now" feature and I will pay for shipping!---- YES, FREE SHIPPING (U.S./4.95 toward international) when purchased via "buy it now" for $34.95. Thanks and good luck! The Godfather II 5 stars!--Both sequel and prequel to The Godfather (1972), Francis Ford Coppola's The Godfather, Part II (1974) delves further into the dark side of the capitalist American Dream by paralleling the young Vito Corleone's 1910s rise with his son Michael's 1950s spiritual fall. To create a more contemplative view of the Corleones' American success story, Coppola cross-cut between Vito's story (in subtitled Italian) and Michael's, revealing how the honorable aim of protecting the family degenerates into an excuse for wielding lethal power, for the sake only of business. Images of Vito's parental concern and immigrant neighborhood dealings dissolve to Michael's familial disintegration and U.S. Senate subterfuge. Cinematographer Gordon Willis's warm sepia tones for the Vito sequences recall period photographs, contrasting sharply with the crass brightness and cold shadows of 1950s Lake Tahoe and Havana. With the memory of The Godfather present in Robert De Niro's uncanny evocation of Marlon Brando and in flashbacks to 1942, Coppola underlines how much The Godfather's potentially alluring myth of family unity begat horrific violence; the film becomes both a critique of responses to the first film that may have glorified its family-oriented violence and a more explicit and mournful allegory of American corporate violence and corruption across the 20th century. These aspects, together with the unique cross-cut narrative, give the movie a richer dimension and a wider scope than the first one's family drama, and it was hailed by most observers as the rare sequel that equaled, or even surpassed, the original. A box office hit, it was nominated for 10 Oscars and won 6, including Best Picture, the Director prize denied Coppola in 1972, Supporting Actor for De Niro, Art Direction, and Score. Years of sequel plans finally produced The Godfather Part III in 1990; and parts I and II were later cut together in chronological order for TV as The Godfather Saga, eliminating this film's cross-cut structure. Often equated with Citizen Kane (1941), The Godfather Part II remains one of the most artistically challenging popular films ever made. _ Lucia Bozzola Go to Allmovie.com for all your movie needs! Item.Name: The Gathering Ed Asner Christmas Classic 1977

Bidder.Location: CHECK OUT ALL MY AUCTIONS! Happy Holidays!

Item.Description: Adam is a man whose time is running out and for whom life has saved the very best for last. Ed Asner and Maureen Stapleton star in this poignant Emmy-Award winning Christmas special that has become a seasonal classic. Adam has spent most of his life building up a successful business in New England, and in the process has alienated his entire family: his wife Kate (Stapleton)and his four children. But when Adam learns the jarring truth that he has less than a year to live, he realizes the foolish mistakes he's made in his life and seeks out his wife's help in gathering the family at Christmas, while keeping his illness a secret. At first, none of the children will be able to attend the reunion. Then, on Christmas Eve, one by one, the children arrive for a most touching reconciliation. This is a rare, sensitive film that will be cherished for many years. 94 minutes. 1977. One owner, me. Video is good and box has general wear. Buyer to pay shipping, Priority Mail. Item.Name: PAINT YOUR WAGON-2 vhs set-NEW-Sealed
Item.Description: PAINT YOUR WAGON a 2 vhs Set These are BRAND NEW, originally FACTORY SEALED (NEVER BEEN VIEWED or OPENED) and in MINT condition Starring: Lee Marvin, Clint Eastwood, Jean Seberg, Harve Presnell, Ray Walston, Tom Ligon, Alan Dexter, L. William O'Connell, Ben Baker, Alan Baxter, Paula Trueman, Robert Easton And Directed By: Joshua Logan. This blockbuster musical is set in No Name City, California during the gold rush, this musical comedy concerns prospectors Ben and Pardner and their unusual nuclear family. The business partners strike a deal to share Ben's wife Elizabeth, whom Ben purchased from a Mormon. But the free-thinking Ben is worried about rivalry over Elizabeth from the town's all-male population, hungry for female company. So he arranges to kidnap a stagecoach full of working girls on their way to a nearby city, and sets up a brothel in No Name. That puts the place on the map and business booms, but competition for gold also grows. Later, needing cash to survive the winter, Ben and an accomplice, Mad Jack Duncan, tunnel under the town's buildings to catch loose golddust falling from the floorboards. But No Name collapses under the strain, and everyone moves on, except for Pardner and Elizabeth. Adapted from the hit Broadway play. Studio: Paramount Home Video, Original Release Year: 1969, Rating: PG, Running Time: 2:44, Number of Videos: 2. U.S. buyers pay s/h of $3.95 for U.S.P.S. mail. Item.Name: Guiding Light Kim Zimmer's Earthquake Outfit!
Item.Description: You are bidding on the one and only Reva earthquake outfit! Kim wore this while taping the earthquake scenes which aired from August 3 through August 20, 2001! Included in this truly unique package are pants and a jacket! (T-shirt not included) Kim Zimmer has personally signed both the pants and jacket just for this auction! If you were watching the show and/or saw any pictures, you'd know the outfit...well...looks like it was trapped underground during an earthquake! ;) There's wrinkles, dirt on it, there is a big tear on the back of the jacket and possibly a little fake blood to boot! Not your everyday GL clothing auction, but definitely one of the most unique! And what die-hard Kim/Reva fan wouldn't appreciate it?! We've included various pictures of the outfit on Reva below! Because this item is an original and very rare, we do have a reserve price set. Add $10.00 for priority shipping. Insurance is optional. We are not responsible for items with no insurance.
